verses.verse: And there was a famine <WH7458> in the land <WH776>, beside <WH905> the first <WH7223> famine <WH7458> that was in the days <WH3117> of Abraham <WH85>. And Isaac <WH3327> went <WH3212> unto Abimelech <WH40> king <WH4428> of the Philistines <WH6430> unto Gerar <WH1642>.
And the Lord <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> unto him <WH559>, and said, Go not down <WH3381> into Egypt <WH4714>; live <WH7931> in the land <WH776> which I shall tell you of <WH559>:

Stay <WH1481> in this land <WH776>, and I will be with you and will bless <WH1288> you for unto you and unto your seed <WH2233>, I will give <WH5414> all these <WH411> countries <WH776>, and I will perform <WH6965> the oath <WH7621> which I swore <WH7650> unto Abraham <WH85> your father <WH1>;

And I will make <WH7235> your seed <WH2233> to multiply <WH7235> as the stars <WH3556> of heaven <WH8064>, and will give <WH5414> unto your seed <WH2233> all these <WH411> countries <WH776>; and in your seed <WH2233> shall all the nations <WH1471> of the earth <WH776> be blessed <WH1288>;
Because <WH6118> that Abraham <WH85> obeyed <WH8085> my voice <WH6963>, and kept <WH8104> my charge <WH4931>, my commandments <WH4687>, my statutes <WH2708>, and my laws <WH8451>.
And Isaac <WH3327> lived <WH3427> in Gerar <WH1642>:

And the men <WH582> of the place <WH4725> asked <WH7592> him of his wife <WH802>; and he said <WH559>, She is my sister <WH269>: for he feared <WH3372> to say <WH559>, She is my wife <WH802>; lest <WH582>, said he, the men of the place <WH4725> should kill <WH2026> me for Rebekah <WH7259>; because she was fair <WH2896> to look upon <WH4758>.

And it came to pass <WH748>, when he had been there a long time <WH3117>, that Abimelech <WH40> king <WH4428> of the Philistines <WH6430> looked out <WH8259> at <WH1157> a window <WH2474>, and saw <WH7200>, and <WH3327>, behold, Isaac was sporting <WH6711> with Rebekah <WH7259> his wife <WH802>.

And Abimelech <WH40> called <WH7121> Isaac <WH3327>, and said <WH559>, Behold <WH389>, surely she is your wife <WH802>: and why said <WH559> you She is my sister <WH269>? And Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> unto him <WH559>, Because I said, Lest I die for her <WH4191>.

And Abimelech <WH40> said <WH559>, What is this you have done <WH6213> unto us <WH259>? one of the people <WH5971> might lightly <WH4592> have lain <WH7901> with your wife <WH802>, and you should have brought <WH935> guiltiness upon us <WH817>.
And Abimelech <WH40> charged <WH6680> all his people <WH5971>, saying <WH559>, He that touches <WH5060> this man <WH376> or his wife <WH802> shall surely <WH4191> be put to death <WH4191>.
Then Isaac <WH3327> sowed <WH2232> in that land <WH776>, and received <WH4672> in the same year <WH8141> one hundred times <WH3967>: and the Lord <WH3068> blessed him <WH1288>.
And the man <WH376> grew great <WH1431>, and went <WH3212> forward <WH1980>, and grew <WH1432> until he became <WH1431> very <WH3966> great <WH1431>:
For he had possession <WH4735> of flocks <WH6629>, and possession <WH4735> of herds <WH1241>, and a great number <WH7227> of servants <WH5657>: and the Philistines <WH6430> envied him <WH7065>.

For all the wells <WH875> which his father <WH1>'s servants <WH5650> had dug <WH2658> in the days <WH3117> of Abraham <WH85> his father <WH1>, the Philistines <WH6430> had stopped <WH5640> them <WH4390>, and filled them with earth <WH6083>.
And Abimelech <WH40> said <WH559> unto Isaac <WH3327>, Go <WH3212> from us <WH3966>; for you are much mightier than we <WH6105>.
And Isaac <WH3327> departed <WH3212> there and pitched his tent <WH2583> in the valley <WH5158> of Gerar <WH1642>, and lived <WH3427> there <WH8033>.

And Isaac <WH3327> dug <WH2658> again <WH7725> the wells <WH875> of water <WH4325>, which they had dug <WH2658> in the days <WH3117> of Abraham <WH85> his father <WH1>; for the Philistines <WH6430> had stopped <WH5640> them after <WH310> the death <WH4194> of Abraham <WH85>: and he called <WH7121> their names <WH8034> after the names <WH8034> by which <WH834> his father <WH1> had called them <WH7121>.
And Isaac <WH3327>'s servants <WH5650> dug <WH2658> in the valley <WH5158>, and found <WH4672> there a well <WH875> of spring <WH2416> water <WH4325>.

And the herdsmen <WH7462> of Gerar <WH1642> did argue <WH7378> with Isaac <WH3327>'s herdsmen <WH7462>, saying <WH559>, The water <WH4325> is ours <WH7121>: and he called the name <WH8034> of the well <WH875> Esek <WH6230>; because they argued with him <WH6229>.
And they dug <WH2658> another <WH312> well <WH875>, and strove <WH7378> for that also <WH7121>: and he called the name of it <WH8034> Sitnah <WH7856>.

And he removed <WH6275> from there and dug <WH2658> another <WH312> well <WH875>; and for that they strove <WH7378> not <WH7121>: and he called the name of it <WH8034> Rehoboth <WH7344>; and he said <WH559>, For now <WH6258> the Lord <WH3068> has made room <WH7337> for us <WH6509>, and we shall be fruitful in the land <WH776>.
And he went up <WH5927> from there to Beer <WH884>–sheba.

And the Lord <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> unto him the same night <WH3915>, and said <WH559>, I am the God <WH430> of Abraham <WH85> your father <WH1>: fear <WH3372> not <WH854>, for I am with you and will bless <WH1288> you and multiply <WH7235> your seed <WH2233> for my servant <WH5650> Abraham <WH85>'s sake.

And he built <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> there <WH7121>, and called upon the name <WH8034> of the Lord <WH3068>, and pitched <WH5186> his tent <WH168> there <WH3327>: and there Isaac's servants <WH5650> dug <WH3738> a well <WH875>.
Then Abimelech <WH40> went <WH1980> to him from Gerar <WH1642>, and Ahuzzath <WH276> one of his friends <WH4828>, and Phichol <WH6369> the chief captain <WH8269> of his army <WH6635>.
And Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> unto them <WH4069>, Why come <WH935> you to me <WH8130>, seeing you hate me <WH7971>, and have sent me away from you?

And they said <WH559>, We saw <WH7200> certainly <WH7200> that the Lord <WH3068> was with you and we said <WH559>, Let there be now an oath <WH423> between <WH996> us <WH996>, even between us and you and let us make <WH3772> a covenant with you <WH1285>

That you will do <WH6213> us no hurt <WH7451>, as we have not touched <WH5060> you and as we have done <WH6213> unto you nothing but <WH7535> good <WH2896>, and have sent you away <WH7971> in peace <WH7965>: you are now <WH6258> the blessed <WH1288> of the Lord <WH3068>.
And he made <WH6213> them a feast <WH4960>, and they did eat <WH398> and drink <WH8354>.

And they rose up some time <WH7925> in the morning <WH1242>, and swore <WH7650> one <WH376> to another <WH251>: and Isaac <WH3327> sent them away <WH7971>, and they departed <WH3212> from him in peace <WH7965>.

And it came to pass the same day <WH3117>, that Isaac <WH3327>'s servants <WH5650> came <WH935>, and told <WH5046> him concerning <WH182> the well <WH875> which they had dug <WH2658>, and said <WH559> unto him <WH4672>, We have found water <WH4325>.
And he called <WH7121> it Shebah <WH7656>: therefore the name <WH8034> of the city <WH5892> is Beer <WH884>–sheba unto this day <WH3117>.

And Esau <WH6215> was forty <WH705> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> when he took <WH3947> to wife <WH802> Judith <WH3067> the daughter <WH1323> of Beeri <WH882> the Hittite <WH2850>, and Bashemath <WH1315> the daughter <WH1323> of Elon <WH356> the Hittite <WH2850>:
Which were a grief <WH4786> of mind <WH7307> unto Isaac <WH3327> and to Rebekah <WH7259>.
